text: There are two basic ways to build jupyter + julia in docker. You can start with the jupyter project’s images and put julia on top, or you can start with the official julia image and put jupyter on top. I argue for the latter approach because the jupyter project’s images contain way too much stuff you don’t need, and the julia installation might not work quite as well.
